headline: 2 Reasons to Like BR and 1 to Stay Skeptical
summary: In a sliding market, Broadridge has defied the odds, trading up to $239.01 per share. Its 11.2% gain since September 2024 has outpaced the S&P 500’s 1.4% drop. This was partly due to its solid quarterly results, and the run-up might have investors contemplating their next move.
